title: Adaptive capacity of islands of the Maldives to Climate change
description: Adaptive capacity or ability to cope with climate change impacts is essential for the sustainable future of the Maldives. Islands of the Maldives are currently facing climate change threats, making adaptation vital. The disproportionate socio ecological dimensions within the islands, and their exposure and sensitivity, causes adaptive capacity variations among them. This study will characterise and measure current adaptive capacity of islands to adjust and moderate potential impacts of climate change.  In addition ability to utilize opportunities to become resilient will be explored. Indicators of natural and social dimensions which influence adaptive capacity will be assessed and quantified to understand level of adaptive capacity in islands. The research will be instrumental in understanding how the islandsâ€™ social, economic and natural systems may respond to future consequences of climate change
